name: knitting badge neckerchief
notes:
**knitting badge neckerchief**

this cute little garter neckerchief is a must have for summer, or when you just want to feel like you are in the scouts. the knitting badge neckerchief can easily be whipped up in one sitting, although you could make it any size you want and if you make it really large it might not be that quick. 
use cotton or linen yarn for a cute summer accessory or wool for a little neck warmer for early spring and autumn. 

knit this with any yarn and on any size needles, following the simple repeat until you get a size you’re happy with. the samples made on 2,5mm needles work perfectly to tie around your neck and the one made on 4mm needles look great with a small ring to keep it in place. 

**yarn and tools**
grab whatever yarn you want
grab any needle size that makes you happy
see the details of the samples as examples. 
2 x stitch markers
1 x tapestry needle for weaving in ends

**samples (see image with 4 samples)**

pink scarf (right)
needles: 4mm
yarn: sandnes line 
53% cotton, 33% viscose, 14% linen
meterage 34g / 75m
size after blocking: 80 cm x 25 cm
4 repeats before the last garter stitch section

beige scarf (bottom)
needles: 2,5mm
yarn: järbo bambu raggi
50% wool, 25% polyamide, 25% bamboo
meterage 22g / 90m
size after blocking: 65x21 cm
5 repeats before the last garter stitch section

beige scarf (top)
needles: 2,5mm
yarn: isager hør – 100% linen
meterage 25g / 90m 
size after blocking and wear: 88x28 cm
5 repeats before the last garter stitch section
note: this yarn stretched out a bit more when
tying around my neck several times. 

pink scarf  (left)
needles: 2,5mm
yarn: sandnes tynn line
53% cotton, 33% viscose, 14% linen
meterage 17g / 75m 
size after blocking: 78x22 cm
5 repeats before the last garter stitch section
